TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed DataGridViewTriState extends System.Enum

Docs.summary: Defines values for specifying one of three possible states.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The DataGridViewTriState enumeration is useful whenever a third state is needed in addition to the two states of the <xref:System.Boolean> type. For example, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.WrapMode%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property is of type DataGridViewTriState so that a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> object can indicate no preference in regards to the text wrapping of a cell value, and can instead indicate that the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.WrapMode%2A> value of a different <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle> object should be used.
## Examples The following code example illustrates the use of this type.
[!code-cs[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc#074](~/add/codesnippet/csharp/t-system.windows.forms.d_2_1.cs)] [!code-vb[System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewMisc#074](~/add/codesnippet/visualbasic/t-system.windows.forms.d_2_1.vb)]

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState False = int32(2)
.field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState NotSet = int32(0)

Docs.summary: The property is not set and will behave in a default manner.

MemberSignature.Value: .field public static literal valuetype System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTriState True = int32(1)
